Package communication.mock

Class TestClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.java_websocket.WebSocketAdapter
      • org.java_websocket.AbstractWebSocket
        • org.java_websocket.client.WebSocketClient
          • communication.mock.TestClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, org.java_websocket.WebSocket, org.java_websocket.WebSocketListener
    public class TestClient
extends org.java_websocket.client.WebSocketClient
    This TestClient class is used for testing the communication with the server.
    Author:
    Matthias Ruf, Sarah Engele, Adrian Groeber

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      java.util.List<ConfigHero> chosenHeroes
      The heroes selected by the player in the characterSelection
      java.lang.String deviceID
      A unique ID, in our case a random number between 0 and 99 (will be sent to the server)
      Entities[][] gameField
      gameField, which is the equivalent of model in the test client
      ConfigHero[] heroSet
      contains the twelve ConfigHeros to choose from
      boolean ingame
      indicates whether client is in inGame Phase (wants to send requests)
      static int logMessageCount
      counts the messages in the logFile
      MatchConfig matchConfig
      MatchConfig of the game
      java.lang.String optionals
      stores whatever should be send in the optionals field
      int playerNumber
      defines which number the client has, in relation to the game. 0 represents Spectator 1 represents PlayerOne 2 represents PlayerTwo
      ConfigHero[] playerOneHeroes
      The HeroSet of Player1 during the game
      java.lang.String playerOneName
      Username of Player 1 (received in the GameStructure message)
      ConfigHero[] playerTwoHeroes
      The HeroSet of Player2 during the game
      java.lang.String playerTwoName
      Username of Player 2 (received in the GameStructure message)
      boolean reconnect
      decides whether the client wants to reconnect to a existing game or start a new game, if the server sends a HelloClient message with boolean runningGame = true.
      Role role
      the role of the TestClient, by default Role.Player
      ScenarioConfig scenarioConfig
      ScenarioConfig of the game
      java.lang.String username
      Stores the name of the user

        the role of the TestClient, by default Role.Player

      • reconnect

        public boolean reconnect
        decides whether the client wants to reconnect to a existing game or start a new game, if the server sends a HelloClient message with boolean runningGame = true. This variable is false by default.

        contains the twelve ConfigHeros to choose from

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public boolean connect​(long timeout)
        This methode connects the TestClient to the server. Therefore this methode uses the arguments given in the constructor and the connectBlocking methode of the super class.
        Parameters:
        timeout - time in milliseconds until the timeout
        Returns:
        was the WebSocket connection establishment successful

      • onOpen

        public void onOpen​(org.java_websocket.handshake.ServerHandshake handshake_data)
        onOpen is called when the connection to the Server is established. It sends a HelloServer-Message Object.
        Specified by:
        onOpen in class org.java_websocket.client.WebSocketClient
        Parameters:
        handshake_data - unused in our implementation. In my understanding the attribut contains information about the WebSocket handshake with the server.

      • onMessage

        public void onMessage​(java.lang.String message)
        The onMessage method is called whenever a message is received by the WebSocket connection. It also specifies what measures have to be taken depending on the message type.
        Specified by:
        onMessage in class org.java_websocket.client.WebSocketClient
        Parameters:
        message - the incoming message (JSON String specified in the network standard document).

      • processTurn

        public void processTurn​(TurnEvent turnEvent)
        calculates a network standard correct turn, based on the given informations.

      • printGameField

        public java.lang.String printGameField()

      • onClose

        public void onClose​(int code,
                    java.lang.String reason,
                    boolean remote)
        Called after the websocket connection has been closed
        Specified by:
        onClose in class org.java_websocket.client.WebSocketClient
        Parameters:
        code - error code. For a more detailed overview CloseFrame
        reason - additional information about the reason of the error
        remote - Returns whether or not the closing of the connection was initiated by the remote host.

      • onError

        public void onError​(java.lang.Exception ex)
        The onStart method is called when the Server is started.
        Specified by:
        onError in class org.java_websocket.client.WebSocketClient
        Parameters:
        ex - The exception causing this error

      • getMessagesIn

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getMessagesIn()
        Getter of the messagesIn attribut. Returns a list of all messages the testClient received.
        Returns:
        a (JSON string formatted list representation) of all received messages.

      • getMessagesOut

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getMessagesOut()
        Getter of the messagesOut attribut. Returns a list of all sent messages.
        Returns:
        a (JSON string formatted list representation) of all sent messages.

      • send

        public void send​(java.lang.String message)
        Sends text to the connected websocket server by using the super methode. It also logs the outgoing message by adding it to the messageOut list.
        Specified by:
        send in interface org.java_websocket.WebSocket
        Overrides:
        send in class org.java_websocket.client.WebSocketClient
        Parameters:
        message - The json string representation of the message.

      • sendCharacterSelection

        public void sendCharacterSelection​(java.lang.Boolean[] characterSelection)
        Sends a CharacterSelection message object created by using the given parameters to the server. The optional field of the message is filled by a null value
        Parameters:
        characterSelection - true if the player has chosen the character, false if not. The size of this array is 12 by definition.

      • sendDisconnectRequest

        public void sendDisconnectRequest()
        Sends a DisconnectRequest to the server. This will initiate the disconnection process.
